item.title: Angela Merkel's mixed legacy: Open-door policy, rise of far right - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
Angela Merkel's mixed legacy: Open-door policy, rise of far right  Al Jazeera English

It has been described by German media as the "decision of her life". When Angela Merkel let more than 800,000 refugees into the country in the summer of 2015, few could have predicted the fall-out that would follow. Over the past three years, her government has been embroiled in bitter political infighting and the surge in support for right-wing policies and the populist party Alternative for Deutschland (AFD) has led commentators to question just how much this decision led to her departure. On Friday, the Christian Democratic Union of Germany (CDU), the party Merkel led for 18 years, chose...

item.title: Twitter takes on Merkel over gift to mark end of her CDU party reign - RT
item.description:
Twitter takes on Merkel over gift to mark end of her CDU party reign  RT

German Chancellor Angela Merkel was presented with a gift, immediately branded as tactless, as she stepped down from more than 18 years as the leader of Germany‚Äôs CDU party. At the CDU party conference in Hamburg, which saw Merkel-protege Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer elected as the new party leader, the chancellor was presented with a framed music baton. It was the one used by Kent Nagano to conduct a Beethoven concert at Hamburg‚Äôs Elbphilharmonie concert hall during last year‚Äôs G20 summit. "Mit meiner gr√∂ssten Verehrung f√ºr Angela Merkel, die wichtigste Dirigentin der Weltpolitik. Ihr Kent N...

item.title: New head of Merkel party seeks to build bridges with rivals - The Associated Press
item.description:
New head of Merkel party seeks to build bridges with rivals  The Associated Press

BERLIN (AP) ‚Äî Chancellor Angela Merkel's successor at the helm of Germany's main center-right party sought to consolidate her power on Saturday after a narrow victory, installing a young conservative in a key leadership post in an effort to build bridges with her rivals. Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, a Merkel ally close to her centrist stance, was elected as chairwoman of the Christian Democratic Union on Friday. She narrowly defeated Friedrich Merz, a one-time Merkel rival representing a more traditionally conservative approach and a clearer break from the longtime chancellor's era. Another ...

item.title: Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, a Merkel protege, elected leader of Germany's ruling party - CNN
item.description:
Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, a Merkel protege, elected leader of Germany's ruling party  CNN

Germany's ruling Christian Democratic Union party elected Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer to succeed Chancellor Angela Merkel as its new leader on Friday. Kramp-Karrenbauer, nicknamed AKK, is often portrayed as a "mini Merkel," following the Chancellor's leadership path, first as Saarland's regional premier, then party secretary, appointed by Merkel. She likely will lead the CDU into the 2021 federal elections and could become the country's next Chancellor. Kramp-Karrenbauer is said to have a similar style to Merkel: soft-spoken but determined and pragmatic, with a record of finding political so...

item.title: With France on the brink and Germany in limbo, Europe is in a dangerous place - The Independent
item.description:
With France on the brink and Germany in limbo, Europe is in a dangerous place  The Independent

For all of Europe‚Äôs many crises ‚Äì Italian debt, migration, troublesome eastern states, Brexit ‚Äì it seemed until relatively recently that its political leadership was at least strong and stable, to borrow a phrase. As Angela Merkel‚Äôs 18-year reign in Germany drew towards a slightly anti-climactic finale, the emergence of the energetic, charismatic new president of France, Emmanuel Macron, seemed to promise at least another firm hand pointing the way. Now that Ms Merkel‚Äôs Christian Democrats have chosen the favourite to succeed her, Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, the French seem equally set on r...

item.title: Merkel ally becomes German conservative party's leader - The Associated Press
item.description:
Merkel ally becomes German conservative party's leader  The Associated Press

HAMBURG, Germany (AP) ‚Äî Angela Merkel's center-right party elected an ally of the longtime German chancellor as its new leader on Friday, opting for continuity and experience as it handed her the challenge of opening a new chapter and improving the party's electoral fortunes. Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, 56, narrowly defeated one-time Merkel rival Friedrich Merz to become the Christian Democratic Union's new chairwoman. The vote came hours after the party feted Merkel with a lengthy standing ovation as she wrapped up 18 years at the helm. Merkel has said she plans to remain chancellor until ...

THE WALL STREET JOURNAL By Bojan Pancevski Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer will become party chairwoman protecting the chancellor‚Äôs hold on power Getty Images HAMBURG‚ÄîAngela Merkel bowed out of party politics on Friday as her conservatives elected a close ally of the chancellor to succeed her as head of her party, beginning what could be an protracted twilight for one of Europe‚Äôs most resilient leaders. In an emotional speech marking the end of her 18 years as leader of the country‚Äôs largest political party, Merkel bade farewell to her troops. ‚ÄúI know I have at times tested your nerves. It is no...

item.title: AKK's victory will allow Merkel a dignified exit - but little more than that - The Telegraph
item.description:
AKK's victory will allow Merkel a dignified exit - but little more than that  The Telegraph

Angela Merkel may be on her way out, but as she plots her departure from an increasingly chaotic European political stage she demonstrated once again yesterday why she is one of the great political survivors. The election of Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer by the narrow margin of just 35 out of nearly 1,000 votes came after Mrs Merkel used her valedictory speech as leader of the CDU to quietly knife the pretender to the crown - the conservative millionaire banker Friedrich Merz. Back in 2002 Mrs Merkel elbowed aside Mr Merz as CDU parliamentary leader in order to cement her own ascent to power; ...

item.title: The Latest: Merkel ally elected leader of chancellor's party - The Associated Press
item.description:
The Latest: Merkel ally elected leader of chancellor's party  The Associated Press

HAMBURG, Germany (AP) ‚Äî The Latest on the election of a successor to Angela Merkel as Christian Democratic Union party leader (all times local): 5:10 p.m. Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, an ally of German Chancellor Angela Merkel, has been elected as the new leader of Merkel's center-right party. Kramp-Karrenbauer narrowly defeated Friedrich Merz, a one-time Merkel rival, at a congress of the Christian Democratic Union in Hamburg on Friday. She won 517 votes to Merz's 482 in a run-off. A third candidate, Health Minister Jens Spahn, was eliminated in a first round of voting. The 56-year-old Kram...

item.title: Ally of German Chancellor Merkel Elected to Succeed Her as Party Leader - VOA News
item.description:
Ally of German Chancellor Merkel Elected to Succeed Her as Party Leader  VOA News

A close ally has been elected to succeed German Chancellor Angela Merkel as the leader of the country's center-right Christian Democratic Union. Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, the party's current general secretary, narrowly defeated former Merkel rival Friedrich Merz 517 to 482 at a congress of the party Friday in Hamburg. Merz sought to move the CDU further to the right. A third candidate, Health Minister Jens Spahn, an outspoken critic of Merkel's 2015 decision to welcome more than 1 million asylum-seekers to Germany, was eliminated in a first round of voting. The win by the 56-year-old mode...

item.title: Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer elected Merkel's successor as CDU leader - The Guardian
item.description:
Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer elected Merkel's successor as CDU leader  The Guardian

Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, a staunchly Catholic conservative career politician, has been elected as the successor to Angela Merkel as leader of Germany‚Äôs Christian Democrats. Kramp-Karrenbauer won by just 25 votes following a nail-biting second round run-off against her main opponent, the multi-millionaire businessman Friedrich Merz. Wiping away tears, Kramp-Karrenbauer said she would accept the post, and thanked the party for its support and trust in her, insisting she would give new impetus to the party as it seeks to claw back the millions of voters it has lost to rightwing populists an...

item.title: Germany's CDU holds second vote to decide on new leader - Reuters
item.description:
Germany's CDU holds second vote to decide on new leader  Reuters

German conservative Annegret Kramp Karrenbauer won most support in a vote on Friday to choose a successor for Angela Merkel as leader of their Christian Democrats (CDU), but a final round of voting is needed to determine an outright winner. Kramp-Karrenbauer won 450 votes, compared with 392 votes for Friedrich Merz in the first round. The third candidate, Health Minister Jens Spahn, got 157 votes, which means he drops out. The CDU's 1,001 delegates immediately began voting in a run-off between Kramp-Karrenbauer and Merz to decide the winner. (Writing by Paul Carrel; Editing by Madeline Cham...

item.title: üá©üá™Germany's conservative CDU party to vote on Merkel's successor l Al Jazeera English - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
üá©üá™Germany's conservative CDU party to vote on Merkel's successor l Al Jazeera English  Al Jazeera English

Germany's ruling party Christian Democratic Union (CDU) will elect a new leader to replace Angela Merkel on Friday. The choice they make will shape the future of German politics and may determine how long Merkel stays on as the chancellor. Al Jazeera's Dominic Kane reports. - Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/ #Germany #Merkel

item.title: Merkel protege Kramp-Karrenbauer succeeds her as German CDU leader - Reuters
item.description:
Merkel protege Kramp-Karrenbauer succeeds her as German CDU leader  Reuters

Germany's Christian Democrats elected Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer on Friday to replace Angela Merkel as party leader, a decision that moves her into pole position to succeed Europe's most influential leader as chancellor. Kramp-Karrenbauer, 56, is Merkel's protege and was the continuity candidate favored by the party elite. She won the leadership with 517 votes out of 999 votes cast by delegates. Her rival, Friedrich Merz, won 482 votes in a run-off. A former state premier in Saarland, where she led a three-way coalition, Kramp-Karrenbauer has a reputation for uniting support across the cons...

item.title: Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer: Moderate to succeed Angela Merkel as leader of Germany's CDU party - The Independent
item.description:
Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer: Moderate to succeed Angela Merkel as leader of Germany's CDU party  The Independent

Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer will succeed Angela Merkel as the leader of Germany‚Äôs main conservative party, it has been announced. Ms Kramp-Karrenbauer, known to German political insiders as ‚ÄúAKK‚Äù, won a run-off vote of delegates at the CDU party conference on Friday afternoon. The relative moderate ‚Äì thought to be the favoured successor of Ms Merkel herself ‚Äì saw off the pro-business rival of the chancellor Friedrich Merz, and social conservative Jens Spahn. Ms Merkel has led the Christian Democrats for 18 years and will stay on as the chancellor leading the German government until the next ...

item.title: German CDU elects Kramp-Karrenbauer as new party leader - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
German CDU elects Kramp-Karrenbauer as new party leader  Al Jazeera English

Chancellor Angela Merkel will be replaced by Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer as the leader of Germany's centre-right Christian Democratic Union (CDU) party. The choice was made by 999 voting delegates at a party congress in German city of Hamburg on Friday, the day Merkel was seen off with a nine-minute standing ovation after 18 years as the party chief. Friday's two-round vote came weeks after Merkel, 64, decided in October not to seek a re-election to the post, but expressed her readiness to stay on as Germany's chancellor for the remaining three years of her term. Kramp-Karrenbauer - a Merkel...

item.title: Friday briefing: Brexit ‚Äì which way to Norway? - The Guardian
item.description:
Friday briefing: Brexit ‚Äì which way to Norway?  The Guardian

Top story: Ministers scramble to avoid no deal Hello and welcome to the last Briefing of the week, with me, Warren Murray. Cabinet‚Äôs soft Brexit faction appears increasingly convinced a ‚ÄúNorway plus‚Äù option may be the only route to Brexit that can command a majority in parliament, it has emerged, after Theresa May convened a crisis meeting in Downing Street with ministers. May has come under pressure to call off next Tuesday‚Äôs vote on her deal in order to avoid defeat. Last night a proposed Tory amendment to give MPs power over the ‚Äúbackstop‚Äù, including committing the government to it lasti...

item.title: Merkel gets standing ovation from party as she bids farewell as leader - ABC News
item.description:
Merkel gets standing ovation from party as she bids farewell as leader  ABC News

German Chancellor Angela Merkel has bowed out as leader of her Christian Democrats (CDU) with an emotional speech to her conservative party as it met to pick her successor, who will move into pole position to become Germany's next leader. The frontrunners are Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, a Merkel protege seen as the continuity candidate, and Friedrich Merz, a Merkel rival who has questioned the constitutional guarantee of asylum to all "politically persecuted" and believes Europe's biggest economy should contribute more to the European Union. Ms Merkel, 64, told the CDU congress in Hamburg o...

item.description:
Ukraine's Naftogaz Wants Trump To Punish Russia Even More  Forbes

Angela Merkel with Vladimir Putin on Aug. 18, 2018 in Germany. Ukraine wants the U.S. Senate to get serious about sanctioning Nord Stream 2 ‚Äî a Russian gas pipeline to Germany. Photographer: Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg A recent dose of semi-hot miltary action in the Azov Sea near Russia‚Äôs Crimea and mainland Ukraine has Kiev parliamentary figures calling on President Trump to go after the Kremlin even more than Washington‚Äôs current sanctions regime. The Russian government attacked Ukrainian naval recently, citing security concerns over a waterway between Crimea to Ukraine, a peninsula still c...

item.title: Factbox: Germany's CDU elects new leader to succeed Merkel - Reuters
item.description:
Factbox: Germany's CDU elects new leader to succeed Merkel  Reuters

Germany's Christian Democrats meet on Friday to decide who succeeds Angela Merkel as party leader, a race that will put the winner in pole position to succeed her as chancellor. Merkel, 64, is not seeking re-election to the post but wants to stay on as chancellor for the remainder of the parliamentary term. The next federal election is due by October 2021. Here are key facts on the candidates seeking to succeed Merkel as leader of the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) and details of the party's voting process. WHO IS RUNNING? ANNEGRET KRAMP-KARRENBAUER - Sometimes dubbed 'mini Merkel' or AKK...

item.title: The candidates vying to replace Angela Merkel as she steps down as CDU leader after 18 years - The Independent
item.description:
The candidates vying to replace Angela Merkel as she steps down as CDU leader after 18 years  The Independent

Angela Merkel has bid her party farewell in an emotional address at its congress in Hamburg. The German chancellor is staying in her post leading the country, but is standing aside from her role leading her party. She has said she will not stand in elections again. Here is a look at the runners and riders to replace her as CDU leader. Whoever wins will be favourite to replace her as chancellor at the party‚Äôs next elections. Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer (EPA) Known to German political insiders as AKK, Ms Kramp-Karrenbauer is the favourite to replace Merkel as leader ...

item.title: How 2018 became Angela Merkel's swan song, and who will succeed her - CNN
item.description:
How 2018 became Angela Merkel's swan song, and who will succeed her  CNN

It has been a trying year for German Chancellor Angela Merkel. In January, she was surveying the damage of a dismal general election and trying to build some kind of a workable coalition. She seemed to be digging in for a long political fight. But by October, Merkel -- arguably the most powerful woman in the world -- had announced this would be her last term in office. This weekend, she will watch as her party, the Christian Democratic Union (CDU), meets to elect a new chairperson after nearly two decades under her leadership. So, how did 2018 become the year of Merkel's swan song? And who ...

item.title: Angela Merkel appeals to CDU to stay in political centre as party votes for new leader - The Telegraph
item.description:
Angela Merkel appeals to CDU to stay in political centre as party votes for new leader  The Telegraph

Angela Merkel made a thinly veiled plea for delegates at the Christian Democrat party conference to vote for her preferred candidate on Friday, as the party prepared to make the biggest decision on its future in almost half a century. In her farewell speech after 18 years at the head of Germany‚Äôs ruling Christian Democratic Union, Mrs Merkel made an emotional appeal to the party to stay in the political centre as 1,001 delegates prepared to voted in a secret ballot for their new leader. Leading the race were Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, a confidant of the chancellor who represents the centre...

item.title: Germany's conservative CDU party to vote on Merkel's successor - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
Germany's conservative CDU party to vote on Merkel's successor  Al Jazeera English

Germany Chancellor Angela Merkel has urged leaders of her Christian Democratic Union (CDU) party to look to the future and stay true to their values, as they prepare to pick her successor on Friday. In her final address to the delegates as party chief, Merkel defended the "Christian, democratic" core values of the CDU, which she led for 18 years. "I wish that in difficult times we shouldn't forget our Christian and democratic stance," she said. Her final address was greeted with a nine-minute standing ovation. Merkel, 64, decided not to seek a re-election to the post but wants to stay on as...

item.title: 'It's been an honour': Angela Merkel steps down after 18 years in charge as CDU picks successor - The Independent
item.description:
'It's been an honour': Angela Merkel steps down after 18 years in charge as CDU picks successor  The Independent

Angela Merkel delivered an emotional speech as the Christian Democrats prepare to choose a new leader, bringing her 18-year reign to an end. Ms Merkel, 64, said in October she would leave her post as party chief but remain as chancellor of Germany until the end of the parliamentary term in 2021. The politician gave an emotional speech as her party met to pick her successor in Hamburg on Friday. Fighting back tears as she received a standing ovation, she told those gathered: "It has been a great pleasure for me, it has been an honour." Ms Merkel, who said she would remain neutral on her succ...

item.title: Angela Merkel's 'cheat sheet' on new Australian PM sparks ridicule - The Telegraph
item.description:
Angela Merkel's 'cheat sheet' on new Australian PM sparks ridicule  The Telegraph

German Chancellor Angela Merkel came armed with a ‚Äúcheat sheet‚Äù, including a photograph, to identify Australia‚Äôs new prime minister before meeting him at the G20 summit ‚Äì an incident seen in Australia as an embarrassing sign of the nation‚Äôs recent leadership chaos. Since Mrs Merkel became Chancellor in 2005, Australia has churned through six prime ministers, including four toppled by their party. Mr Morrison became prime minister in August after the Liberal party ousted Malcolm Turnbull. During Mr Morrison‚Äôs meeting with Mrs Merkel in Argentina, she could be seen holding a sheet which inclu...

item.title: Who is Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer? And what will she do next? - The Telegraph
item.description:
Who is Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer? And what will she do next?  The Telegraph

She is known as the ‚Äúmini-Merkel‚Äù but 56-year-old Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer knows that as she plots her ascent to the German Chancellorship over the next three years she must move out of Angela Merkel‚Äôs shadow. As she was installed as the new leader of Germany‚Äôs ruling Christian Democratic Union yesterday, she wasted no time in delivering that message. While paying a heartfelt tribute to her political sponsor, Ms Kramp-Karrenbauer - or AKK as she is universally known - also warned that she wouldn‚Äôt be the comfortable partner to Mrsk Merkel that many have been assuming. Naming Mrs Merkel di...

item.title: This is the most powerful woman on earth - MarketWatch
item.description:
This is the most powerful woman on earth  MarketWatch

MONEYISH By Catey Hill Hillary Clinton did not appear on this list for the first time since 2004 German Chancellor Angela Merkel talks to US President Donald Trump during the dinner for the participants and partners of the G20 Summit at the Colon Theatre in Buenos Aires, Argentina. item.title: Forbes most powerful women 2018: The people who should have been on the list - The Independent
item.description:
Forbes most powerful women 2018: The people who should have been on the list  The Independent

Forbes has unveiled its annual list of the 100 most powerful women in the world, which this year is topped by German chancellor Angela Merkel. Theresa May, Melinda Gates and YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki are some of the other names included in the business magazine‚Äôs esteemed list, which celebrates the world‚Äôs most high-achieving women who are leading the way in terms of change and disruption in their respective industries. item.title: Who are you? Merkel uses cheat sheet to read up on new Australian PM before G20 meeting - RT
item.description:
Who are you? Merkel uses cheat sheet to read up on new Australian PM before G20 meeting  RT

The internet has expressed solidarity with Angela Merkel after the German leader was seen reading up on Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison before their G20 meeting. The land down under has cycled through five PMs since 2013. Morrison, who became Australia‚Äôs 30th prime minister in August, had his debut meeting with the German chancellor at the G20 summit in Buenos Aires, Argentina. But before the diplomatic pleasantries began, Merkel was spotted reviewing a briefing about Morrison ‚Äì complete with a photograph ‚Äì as the Australian leader sat next to her. @ellinghausen captures Merkel rea...

item.title: End of an era: Angela Merkel's long goodbye - The Guardian
item.description:
End of an era: Angela Merkel's long goodbye  The Guardian

Angela Merkel, 64, has led the centre-right Christian Democratic Union (CDU) party in Germany for 18 years. Now, as she prepares to make way for her successor as chair of the party, she has repeated her intention to see out her term as chancellor. The Guardian‚Äôs Kate Connolly in Berlin reflects on the end of an era in German politics. She highlights the refugee crisis of 2015 and the Greek debt crisis of 2009 as critical moments in what will become Angela Merkel‚Äôs legacy. Also today: Rania Ali was one of thousands of Syrian refugees who arrived in Europe after 2015. She documented her journ...

item.title: German Chancellor Stepping Down as CDU Leader - VOA News
item.description:
German Chancellor Stepping Down as CDU Leader  VOA News

German Chancellor Angela Merkel is stepping down after 18 years as the party leader of the center-right Christian Democratic Union. In her farewell speech at the CDU congress Friday in Hamburg, Merkel thanked her staff and said the party "is never just one person by him or herself, but always all members together." Merkel reminded her fellow party members that experience has shown "how much strength and momentum we can develop" when faced with difficulties. During her half-hour speech she received several standing ovations. Some delegates held up placards saying, "Thank you, boss!'' Merkel ...

item.title: Merkel busted checking 'cheat sheet' with photo of Australian PM at G20 meeting - The Independent
item.description:
Merkel busted checking 'cheat sheet' with photo of Australian PM at G20 meeting  The Independent

Angela Merkel was captured reading a crib sheet of factual notes about Australia's prime minister, Scott Morrison, as the pair sat down together at the G20 summit in Argentina at the weekend. The German chancellor‚Äôs briefing notes contained a brief biography and photograph of Mr Morrison ‚Äì Australia‚Äôs fifth prime minister since 2013 ‚Äì in case she struggled for basic details about him. The Liberal Party leader took office in August this year after his predecessor, Malcolm Turnbull, was forced out by party rivals. Australian media reacted with amusement at the idea the German chancellor neede...

item.title: Merkel‚Äôs ally Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer elected to lead Germany‚Äôs CDU party - RT
item.description:
Merkel‚Äôs ally Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer elected to lead Germany‚Äôs CDU party  RT

Often referred to as Angela Merkel‚Äôs ‚Äúprotege‚Äù and even ‚ÄúMini Merkel,‚Äù CDU General Secretary Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer has been chosen as the conservative German party‚Äôs next leader. Kramp-Karrenbauer, known as AKK, beat out her main rival, corporate lawyer Friedrich Merz, a staunch critic of Merkel whose win would have represented a decisive break from the current chancellor‚Äôs legacy and policies. The vote saw AKK win 517 of the 999 votes, while Merz took 482. item.title: Australia‚Äôs global clout dented by political instability - Financial Times
item.description:
Australia‚Äôs global clout dented by political instability  Financial Times

When Scott Morrison met Angela Merkel at the G20 last weekend, the German chancellor was photographed flicking through her briefing notes on the new Australian prime minister. Ms Merkel was not alone in her bewilderment. Her G20 counterparts were also struggling to keep up with the brutal ‚Äúrevolving door‚Äù leadership culture that characterises recent politics Down Under, where there have been five prime ministers in five years. Donald Trump was more direct when he met Mr Morrison, who replaced Malcolm Turnbull following a leadership coup in August. He simply asked Mr Morrison what had happen...

item.title: Angela Merkel said 'shitstorm,' but it's not as bad as you think - CNN
item.description:
Angela Merkel said 'shitstorm,' but it's not as bad as you think  CNN

When German Chancellor Angela Merkel said "shitstorm" during a speech this week, it had nothing to do with the fact that she is about to step down as her party's leader. While speaking at a digital forum in Nuremberg on Tuesday, Merkel regaled the room with a 2013 incident where she was mocked on social media for describing the internet as "unknown territory." Laughing at the online fallout over her comment, she said "Das hat mir einen grosen Shitstorm eingebracht," which translates as "it generated quite a shitstorm for me." Her use of the vulgar English term brewed its very own storm amon...

item.title: With AKK‚Äôs victory, the post-Merkel era begins - Financial Times
item.description:
With AKK‚Äôs victory, the post-Merkel era begins  Financial Times

The most encouraging aspect of Friday‚Äôs election for the leadership of Germany‚Äôs ruling Christian Democratic Union is that it was a genuine, closely fought contest, not a pre-planned coronation. The process testified to a new vigour in the party and a desire for real, though controlled change. Yet the choice of Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer to succeed Angela Merkel as CDU leader still leaves important unanswered questions about how Germany will adapt to its increasingly fragmented party political system. The expanding number of fragile coalition or caretaker governments around Europe, and the ...

item.title: Where are the women? Fewest female leaders in G20 photo - CNN
item.description:
Where are the women? Fewest female leaders in G20 photo  CNN

Friday's "family photo" at the G20 summit in Argentina marked an inauspicious moment: there were fewer female heads-of-government posing than in any of the previous gatherings of the group. That was due in part to German Chancellor Angela Merkel's absence (her plane had mechanical issues getting to Argentina and she did not arrive in time for the photo). But it also spoke to the lower number of female leaders among the industrialized nations that make up the G20, which began holding leaders summits in 2008. Even had Merkel been there, there would have been only two female country leaders --...

item.title: Germany to Back Russian Gas Link Despite Ukraine Tensions - VOA News
item.description:
Germany to Back Russian Gas Link Despite Ukraine Tensions  VOA News

Germany will not withdraw its political support for the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline with Russia, its foreign minister said on Monday, as some lawmakers suggested curtailing the project to punish Moscow for its seizure of Ukrainian ships and their crew. Russia is resisting international calls to release three Ukrainian ships seized last month in the Kerch Strait, which controls access to the Sea of Azov near the Crimea region that Moscow annexed from Ukraine in 2014. Moscow accuses the 24 sailors of illegally entering Russian waters by trying to pass through the strait. Kyiv says the sailors ...
